Plot CDR3 Length Distributions

Source: R/plot_lengths.R
PlotLengthsByChain.Rd

PlotLengthsByChain plots the distribution of amino acid lengths for CDR3 sequences

PlotLengthsByChain(
  data,
  cell.type = "T",
  plot.type = "stack",
  cdr3 = "aa",
  palette = "bold",
  barOutline = FALSE,
  legend = TRUE,
  gridlines = TRUE,
  alpha = 0.5,
  label = TRUE,
  theme = "pubr",
  bg.color = "light"
)

Arguments

data

cdr3_melt data created from MeltCDR3Lengths
cell.type

Lymphocyte To filter on. Options == c("T", "B", or "all")
plot.type

Type of barplot. Options == c("stack", "dodge", "facet")
cdr3

CDR3 type. Options == c("aa", "nt")
palette

Palettes available from PullPalettes
barOutline

Logical. Whether to include a black outline around the bars in the plot
legend

Logical. Whether to include the legend or not
gridlines

Logical. Include y-axis
alpha

Numerical between 0-1. Alpha level applied to bar-fill.
label

Logical. Add numerical label to the top of the bars
theme

Either ggpubr::theme_pubr("pubr"), or ggpubr::pubclean ("clean"), or ggpubr::theme_transparent ("transparent")
bg.color

Helpful param for applying a global light or dark theme in a scheme, such as global theme for Shiny apps. "light" or "dark".

Value

PlotLengthsByChain

See also

AnalyzeCDR3Lengths

Examples

melt_data <- MeltCDR3Lengths(data = pbmc_vdj)
#> Error in `[.Seurat`(data, c(stringb::text_detect(colnames(data), "length") &     c(stringb::text_detect(colnames(data), "aa")))): Incorrect number of logical values provided to subset features
plot <- PlotLengths(data = melt_data)
#> Error in PlotLengths(data = melt_data): could not find function "PlotLengths"
